sentences.chinese: 穿牛仔褲的人均未準進入。

sentences.english: The Scandinavian countries have the highest number of IPs per person.
sentences.chinese: 斯堪的納維亞國家的人均IP地址數最高。

sentences.english: For code numbers for living environment and per capita living area, please refer to appendix 2.
sentences.chinese: 居住環境編碼包括住所型及人均居住面積請閱附二。

sentences.english: Per capita incomes rose sharply last year.
In China it has risen from 4kg to 54.
sentences.chinese: 中國肉類的人均年消費量從僅4千克達到了54千克。

sentences.english: This is roughly half of the current level of consumption perhead.
sentences.chinese: 這大致是目前人均消費水平的一半。

sentences.english: Its per capita GDP remains one of the lowest in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 它的人均國內生產總值爲歐洲最低的之一。

sentences.english: This agreement is eligible for the successors or concessionaires of any parties.
sentences.chinese: 本協議對每一方的繼承人和受讓人均有約束力。

sentences.english: We stopped the clock at $3200 per head.
sentences.chinese: 我們在人均收入3200美元時停止了這個碼錶。

sentences.english: Per capita, Europeans and North Americans waste between 95 and 115 kilograms of food.
sentences.chinese: 歐洲和北美兩地區人均浪費95到115公斤食物。

sentences.english: As it happens, in that year life expectancy started rising.
sentences.chinese: 因爲恰從那年起，人均預期壽命開始回升。

sentences.english: Consent to the recordal of the license is left to the applicable law of the Member States.
sentences.chinese: 人均表同意此一問題，留予成員國可適用的法律處理。

sentences.english: The per capita GDP in Kenya is just $783 a year.
sentences.chinese: 肯尼亞的年人均國內生產總值只有783美元。

sentences.english: Wages in eastern Germany have also edged up towards western levels.
sentences.chinese: 與此同時，德東的人均收入水平已經趨近德西。

sentences.english: Asian Americans enjoy a high socioeconomic status, are well educated and are healthy.
sentences.chinese: 亞裔美國人均享有高社經地位及良好的教育和健康。

definition: currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
person-times/visits/classifier for number of people participating
to convert into/to amount to/to be equivalent to
to add up the total/to figure what sth amounts to/to consider
